text: The McDonnell Douglas F-15E Strike Eagle is a modernized variant of the F-15 Eagle. It was optimized as an attack aircraft for the US Air Force with a stronger airframe than earlier versions. It has longer range, more powerful radar, and a second seat for the operator of the strike aircraft equipment. Foreign operators are Israel, Saudi Arabia, Singapore, and South Korea. ==Operators== ; *Israeli Air Force - 25 F-15I "Ra'am" aircraft in use as of January 2014"World Military Aircraft Inventory". 2014 Aerospace. Aviation Week and Space Technology, January 2014. ; *Republic of Korea Air Force - 58 F-15Ks in service in January 2014. It ordered a combined 61 F-15K "Slam Eagle" fighters including one lost in an accident.Seung-woo, Kang. "Lockheed's F-35 feels heat from 2 competitors." Korea Times, 16 June 2013. ; *Royal Saudi Air Force - 70 F-15S Eagles in service as of January 2014 ; *Republic of Singapore Air Force (RSAF) - 24 F-15SGs in use as of January 2014. It ordered 24 F-15SG fighters."Speech by Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Defence Teo Chee Hean at the Inauguration of the F-15SG 149 Squadron." MINDEF press release, 5 April 2010. Retrieved: 20 April 2010. ; *United States Air Force - 213 F-15Es in operation as of January 2014 Category:United States Air Force aircraft
title: McDonnell Douglas F-15E Strike Eagle
